post_title: My house in staringstraat was robbed this week. Anyone have tips?

comments.author: avar
comments.body: They used false key for the building, or your apartment in particular? You can change your own apartment key, you don't need the landlord for that.

comments.author: solstice_gilder
comments.body: I would visit the police? Change locks? You can do that yourself btw.

comments.author: TaImePHO
comments.body: Not at all trying to sound like Mr hindsight - but always ALWAYS change your keys when you move into a new place!

comments.author: defiantyy
comments.body:
Check if your important documents were stolen. (Certificates, Passports etc). Make an inventory of atuff that was stolen, this you need for police report and insurance. 
Replace the apartment lock with anti theft locks, get security equipments like RING or Verisure to prevent such a thing from happening again.
Make a police report. 
If you have insurance, contact them with the police report 
Make peace with the fact that you will never get back the stolen stuff, you can earn them back. But its important to feel safe again in the apartment so make sure to get those security measures.

comments.author: jaydizzz
comments.body: Just keep the original cilinder / keys to put back when you move out.
